text: the four Brahmins this is the story of
four Brahmin friends some Vash Jeevan
and boot they lived together in a small
village all four of them were the
students of a sage who lived in the
forest the sage was a simple but a very
learned man the brahmins respected their
teacher every day they would listen to
their teacher very carefully
[Music]
my children anybody can become learn it
but skills alone will not take you
anywhere you have to learn to use it
wisely some Veche and jeevan learnt many
skills Veche could heal a wound without
touching it some could mend a broken pot
Jeevan could take a fallen dead leaf and
attach it back to the tree but bud was
the slowest among all he could not do
any of these things the three friends
would always make jokes on good but has
learnt a new skill he can talk to the
broken pieces of a pot why yes but the
broken pieces have not learnt the skill
to mend poor broken pot never complained
collision what do you mean by common
sense that's easy
common sense is when we think before we
act
[Music]
one day some veg and Jeevan decided to
travel out of the village
this village is too small we will never
be the most learned men if we live here
for the rest of our lives we should
travel to learn more I agree we have
gathered all the skills we can now we
should move on
what about bud should we talk to him too
oh he is stupid and useless he will only
be a burden upon us no less we are
stronger than him it is our duty to
protect him we must invite him to come
along with us they all gathered their
clothes and food and prepared for their
journeys remember children a wise man
always thinks before he acts
we will remember Guruji we will remember
Guruji we will remember Guruji we will
remember Guruji the brahmins waved
goodbye to their teacher after walking
for half a day they were tired and
wanted to rest let us eat our lunch here
wise men always store their energies for
coming adventures as they were about to
sit on the rock but saw something lying
on the ground what is that oh good are
you going to be afraid of a pile of
bones now I wonder whose bones are these
I can guarantee you that these belonged
to a lion he must have died of hunger oh
[Music]
yes look at the structure of these bones
I am sure these are Lions bones oh wait
why don't I test my skills on him what a
good way to practice I will rearrange
this pile into a skeleton of a lion
[Music]
before anybody could say anything some
started to chant some words suddenly
there was a bright light on the pile of
bones and it was rearranged into a
skeleton of a lion the three brothers
were surprised see didn't I tell you you
have to be as learn it as I am to do it
you think your skill is the greatest I
can put flesh back into this lion he
will have fur skin nails teeth
everything only in a few minutes
fish don't but fish had stopped
listening
he was now chanting some words suddenly
the skeleton had eyes skin fur nails and
much more it was now a fully made lion
lying dead on the ground
isn't it beautiful it's scary why did
you do that because only I can with my
skill I can bring anything back the lion
have lost its skin and body I brought it
back isn't this the greatest skill you
think only you can bring something back
don't you know what skill I have learned
I can bring this dead lion back to life
yes but who do you think is the most
learn it then he can't decide just by
your words Jeevan do it and show him
then he will decide who is the most
learn it I don't know about the most
learning but I know who is the strongest
the lion don't do this Jeevan please
listen to me while all my friends have
tested their skills you don't want me to
test mine would you call yourself a good
friend fish was right we should have
left you back in the village you will
teach us what Guruji said you who never
learned any skill you don't trust your
friends to you you were right Jeevan he
has not learned a single skill how would
he know the importance of practice but
just because you don't have any skill to
show us you don't want us to test ours
you are jealous of us
oh I do have one skill which is enough
to save my life
common sense is when we think before we
act don't be so angry my friends I will
not stop you now but before you start
let me climb on to a tree if the lion
eats me how will I tell you who is the
most learning one you are a coward
you must brave any situation I will not
lie to my friends but I can't play the
lion and I will have a better view from
the tree I can then decide clearly who
is the most learned bud quickly climbed
onto a nearby tree as Jeevan started
chanting some words within a few minutes
a bright light appeared upon the dead
lion and he opened his eyes the three
Brahmins jumped happily they had now
proved their skills but their smiles
were soon gone the lion got up and bored
angrily
the Lord is alive save yourselves
but the Brahmans were so scared they
could not move the hungry lion left for
the Brahmans at once the poor brothers
did not do anything to save themselves
the lion ate all the three Brahmins one
by one wood was sitting on the tree
watching everything after the lion left
wood climbed down from the tree he saw
that there were only bones left of his
friend but if only you had remembered
Guruji's last message you would not have
met this fate remember children wise is
the man who thinks before he acts
[Music]
